column5: LOL.. Great title...  To bad so sad..  http://mnrwatch.com/minnesota-angler-pleads-guilty-loses-potential-world-record-lake/  I keep wondering why they are saying world record.. i could see Ontario record, but surely someone has caught something bigger say in the NWT??
I think they say "world record" for added drama, but it's a line class record
Thats what I figured... but even still... theres MONSTERS up north..
Something about a "Tip-Up" world record?????  Is that like a Friday afternoon world record???  Anyway--nice fish---good fight thru ice
There is only one type of record that matters.  All tackle!  The rest, well...
So all these "world records" that people are claiming might be illegal/Bull...........................NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO.
I'm the current record holder on One eyed pike while fishing in an east wind---holding my rod with my left hand and wearing prescription sunglasses
I'm the current record holder on One eyed pike while fishing in an east wind---holding my rod with my left hand and wearing prescription sunglasses   Thats impressive!

I'm just kid'n round TJ.....I think the way that ad you posted was wrote was a specific trout line or tip up record---??  Not sure  I did see the world record Laker mounted in the Winnipeg airport many years ago-----a huge fat bellied football just over the 100 lb mark  caught in a net I believe
http://www.lakersunlimited.com/gallery3/Lakers-Lunkers/File0009  In a net though, I thought Great Bear or Great Slave lakes were known for huge lakers?
FYI, any IGFA record must be caught on a rod 40" or longer so a tip-up would not qualify for an IGFA record.  Not sure who is the source behind the "tip-up world record".
Maybe that record was started by manufacturers of Tip ups
